TopicTitle: Modding Monday: Kinetic Penetrator impact probe

Articles.Content: This mod is certainly a unique and very neat one. The goal is to crash the parts the mod provides you with into the surface of your celestial of choice. The device will (fairly) reliably survive impacts up to 100 m/s, after which you can collect scientific data to transmit back to home. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a lot we can say but we advise you check out the video instead. The mod is still in beta and has some known issues, but we approve of the concept! > > See the [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128617](**FORUM THREAD** for more information! >

OMGDAILYKERBALISBACK!

Woot! Been missing hearing from you guys!

Also, cool mod!

Also, first!

Checked out the mod.... Love the "thunk" it makes on impact. It's pretty cool though, would be cool to attach to landers and drop before landing.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-20T22:55:13Z" title="07/20/2015 10:55  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 20, 2015</time> by Endersmens**
THere's been a nice push of impact-oriented science mods as of late. I love it! Gathering data has never been this kerbal.

[I didn't kill The Daily Kerbal!](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/128453-Suggestion-Daily-Kerbal-Replace-the-Twitch-Thursday-with-a-Spacecraft-Thursday) Yay!

Let's see if my suggestion got accepted...
I get the point! Can all experiments be used with this?
Not my cup of tea but Kudos to the author for getting Squad's attention.
Very interesting. I like the hands on science approach, I think it adds further depth to the gameplay of surface science.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129208-1-0-4-Scott-Manley-Head-Pack%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129208-1-0-4-Scott-Manley-Head-Pack%21)

SQUAD! Do this! Please! It's hilarious!
Am I the only one thinking using this as landing gear on gilly?

> 
> Checked out the mod.... Love the "thunk" it makes on impact. It's pretty cool though, would be cool to attach to landers and drop before landing.

Just want to point out that this particular sound comes from the KAS module it uses, so Kospy deserves the credit for the coolness.

Sorry, I'm with [Hellbrand](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/67503-Hellbrand) on this one: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129208-1-0-4-Scott-Manley-Head-Pack%21?p=2090448&viewfull=1#post2090448](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129208-1-0-4-Scott-Manley-Head-Pack%21?p=2090448&viewfull=1#post2090448)

Summary: NO. All kinds of 'nope' here. Nope nope nope. Kill it with fire!!!111oneone
Add me to the "I wonder if I can use it for landing gear" crowd...

Ah, now I actually have a reason to crash in KSP!

Not that I never crash, in fact, I'm already surprised if something I made can get into space without using the developer console ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

And now, with this mod, crashing became science! Awesome!
